verse.text: Symeon Peter, a slave and apostle of Jesus Christ, to those who have been allotted a faith of equal value to ours through the justice of our God and Savior Jesus Christ:
May favor and peace be multiplied to you in the full recognition of God and of Jesus our Lord.
For his divine power has granted to us everything necessary for life and devotion, through the full recognition of the one who called us by his own glory and excellence.

Through these he has granted to us his precious and greatest promises, so that through them you might become sharers in the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world because of disordered desire.
For this very reason, make every effort to supplement your faith with moral excellence, and moral excellence with knowledge,
and knowledge with self-mastery, and self-mastery with steadfast endurance, and steadfast endurance with devotion,
and devotion with sibling affection, and sibling affection with love.
For if these qualities are yours and are increasing, they keep you from being idle or unfruitful in the full recognition of our Lord Jesus Christ.
For whoever lacks these things is blind, being so short-sighted that they have forgotten the cleansing of their past sins.
Therefore, brothers and sisters, be all the more diligent to make your calling and election secure; for by doing these things, you will never stumble.
In this way, the entrance into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ will be richly provided for you.
Therefore, I intend to keep reminding you of these things, even though you know them and are established in the truth that is present with you.
I consider it right, as long as I am in this temporary tent, to wake you up by way of a reminder,
knowing that the laying aside of my tent is coming quickly, just as our Lord Jesus Christ made clear to me.
And I will make every effort so that after my departure you may be able to recall these things at any time.
For we did not follow cleverly crafted myths when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we were eyewitnesses who beheld his majesty.
For he received honor and glory from God the Father when a voice was brought to him by the Majestic Glory, saying: “This is my Son, my Beloved, in whom I have taken delight.”
We ourselves heard this voice brought from heaven while we were with him on the holy mountain.
And we have the prophetic word made more secure, to which you do well to pay attention as to a lamp shining in a murky place, until the day dawns and the Light-bringer rises in your hearts.
Know this first of all: no prophecy of Scripture comes from one’s own explanation,
for no prophecy was ever brought forth by human will, but people spoke from God as they were carried along by the Holy Spirit.

But there were also false prophets among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly introduce destructive sects, even denying the Master-Owner who bought them, bringing swift destruction upon themselves.
And many will follow their ways of unbridled sensuality, and because of them, the Way of Truth will be slandered.
In their greed, they will exploit you with fabricated stories; for them, the judgment pronounced long ago is not idle, and their destruction does not slumber.
For if God did not spare angels who sinned, but committed them to the pits of gloom in Tartarus to be kept for judgment;
and if he did not spare the ancient world, but preserved Noah, a herald of justice, as the eighth person when he brought a flood upon the world of the ungodly;
and if he condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah to destruction by reducing them to ashes, making them an example of what is coming for the ungodly;
and if he rescued the just man Lot, who was oppressed by the conduct of the lawless in their unbridled sensuality
(for by what he saw and heard while living among them day after day, that just man was torturing his just soul because of their lawless deeds)—
then the Lord knows how to rescue the devout from testing, and how to keep the unjust under punishment until the day of judgment,
especially those who go after the flesh in the lust of defilement and despise lordship. Daring and arrogant, they do not tremble when slandering the Celestial Majesties,
whereas angels, though greater in strength and power, do not bring a slandering judgment against them before the Lord.
But these people—like irrational animals, creatures of instinct born to be caught and destroyed—slander things they do not understand. In their corruption, they will also be destroyed,
suffering harm as the wages of injustice. They consider it a pleasure to revel in broad daylight. They are stains and blemishes, reveling in their deceits while they feast with you.
They have eyes full of an adulteress and are restless in sin; they entice unstable souls; they have hearts trained in greed; they are children of a curse.
Leaving the straight path, they have wandered off, following the path of Balaam son of Bosor, who loved the wages of injustice
but received a rebuke for his own lawbreaking: a speechless beast of burden, speaking with a human voice, restrained the prophet’s madness.
These people are waterless springs and mists driven by a storm-gale, for whom the gloom of darkness has been reserved.
For by speaking swelling words of emptiness, they entice by the lusts of the flesh and by unbridled sensuality those who are barely escaping from those who live in error.
They promise them freedom while they themselves are slaves of corruption; for whatever a person is defeated by, to that they are enslaved.

For if, after escaping the defilements of the world through the full knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they are again entangled in them and defeated, the last state has become worse for them than the first.
For it would have been better for them not to have fully known the way of justice than, after knowing it, to turn back from the holy commandment handed down to them.
What the true proverb says has happened to them: “A dog returns to its own vomit,” and, “A sow, after washing, returns to wallowing in the mud.”
Beloved, this is now the second letter I am writing to you. In both of them, I am attempting to wake up your pure mind by way of a reminder,
so that you may recall the words spoken beforehand by the holy prophets and the commandment of our Lord and Savior given through your apostles.
Know this first of all: in the last days, mockery-filled mockers will come, living according to their own desires
and asking, “Where is the promise of his presence? For ever since the fathers fell asleep in death, all things continue exactly as they have from the beginning of creation.”
For they deliberately ignore this: that by the word of God heavens existed long ago and an earth was formed out of water and through water.
Through these waters, the world that then existed was flooded and destroyed.
But by the same word, the present heavens and earth are stored up for fire, being kept for the day of judgment and the destruction of ungodly people.
Do not let this one thing escape your notice, beloved: with the Lord, one day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years are like one day.
The Lord is not slow concerning the promise, as some define slowness, but is patient toward you, not wishing for any to be destroyed but for all to come to a change of heart.

But the day of the Lord will come like a thief. On that day, the heavens will pass away with a rushing roar, the fundamental elements will be dissolved with intense heat, and the earth and the works done in it will be exposed.
Since all these things are to be dissolved in this way, what kind of people ought you to be? You must live in holy conduct and acts of devotion,
waiting for and even hastening the presence of the day of God. Because of that day, the heavens will be dissolved by fire and the fundamental elements will melt with intense heat.
But according to his promise, we are waiting for new heavens and a new earth, in which justice makes its home.
Therefore, beloved, since you are waiting for these things, make every effort to be found by him at peace, without spot or blemish.
Regard the patience of our Lord as salvation, just as our beloved brother Paul also wrote to you according to the wisdom given to him.

He speaks about these things in all his letters. There are some things in them that are hard to understand, which the ignorant and unstable distort—as they do the rest of the Scriptures—to their own destruction.
You therefore, beloved, since you know these things in advance, be on your guard so that you are not carried away by the error of unprincipled people and fall from your own stability.
Instead, grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be the glory both now and to the day of eternity. Amen.
